faqs.question: Why are certain features missing from my version of Blender?
faqs.answer:
[info]Feature availability depends on your Blender version:[/info]

• Features listed in our [link]https://github.com/Yusarina/Cats-Blender-Plugin-Unofficial-/wiki/Features|documentation[/link] are based on the latest LTS version (currently Blender 4.2.x)

• Older or non-LTS versions may have limited functionality

[details]Legacy Features|If you have features in your version that aren't in newer versions, they've been deprecated. View all legacy features [link]https://github.com/Yusarina/Cats-Blender-Plugin-Unofficial-/wiki/Legacy-Features|here[/link].[/details]

[warning]Blender 2.8 to 3.5 Users|These versions are not supported. Please check our [link]https://github.com/Yusarina/Cats-Blender-Plugin-Unofficial-/wiki/Requirements|requirements[/link] for supported versions.[/warning]

faqs.question: Why do my materials turn black/white when using the Fix Materials function?
faqs.answer:
[info]This typically occurs when materials don't have assigned textures. The Fix Materials function assigns a white color by default to materials without textures.[/info]

Troubleshooting Steps:

1. Verify you're using the recommended Blender version
2. Ensure CATS is up to date
3. Check that all materials have assigned textures

[note]VRM Users: You can try downgrading to VRM Addon version 2.15.26:
[link]https://github.com/saturday06/VRM-Addon-for-Blender/releases/download/2_15_26/VRM_Addon_for_Blender-2_15_26.zip|Download VRM 2.15.26[/link][/note]

faqs.question: Why does Blender crash when using CATS?
faqs.answer:
To resolve crashes:

1. Use the recommended Blender version (see main page or readme)
2. Update CATS to the latest version
3. [link]https://github.com/Yusarina/Cats-Blender-Plugin-Unofficial-/issues|Report issues here[/link] if problems persist

[warning]Windows Store Users|The Windows Store version of Blender is NOT supported and may cause issues. Please use either:
• Steam version
• Official Blender website version[/warning]

faqs.question: Why does the Update Checker show incorrect version information?
faqs.answer:
[details]Common Update Checker Issues|

1. Using Outdated Plugin:
• Blender 4.2: Should report version 4.2.x.x
• Older versions reporting 0.50.0 or 3.6.4 need updating

2. Version Number Format:
• Current format: 4.2.x.x (e.g., 4.2.1.0)
• Old format: 0.50.0, 3.6.4 (without final digit)

3. VPN Issues:
• Some VPN providers may interfere with the version checker[/details]

[warning]Important Note|If using versions before 3.6.4.1 or 4.2.2.1, update your plugin first. Issues reported for outdated versions will be closed unless verified as legitimate updater problems.[/warning]

[note]Cross-Version Updates|If the updater suggests a version for a different Blender version, you likely have an old plugin version. Please manually update to the correct version for your Blender installation.[/note]
